rows.NAME: JSON Property Set
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Property sets can be used to store multiple options in one data field, like connection settings (user, password, address, etc.)

rows.NAME: Text
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: A text field is longer than a string an may contain multiple lines

rows.NAME: URL
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: URL, File-Links, etc.

rows.NAME: UXON
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema)

rows.NAME: Markdown
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Text formatted via markdown

rows.NAME: Relative File Path
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: /folder/subfolder/filename or folder/subfolder/filename

rows.NAME: Numeric ID (Integer)
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Use this type for all kinds of ids, keys, etc. It is numeric, but has neither fractions nor digit grouping.

rows.NAME: Generic List (String Enumeration)
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Allows to define a list of valid string values directly in the model (without creating a custom data type). This is handy if a data type is only used for a single attribute -  you can create a custom configuration for this generic type and don't need

rows.NAME: Generic List (Number Enumeration)
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Allows to define a list of valid numeric values directly in the model (without creating a custom data type). This is handy if a data type is only used for a single attribute -  you can create a custom configuration for this generic type and don't nee

rows.NAME: Year
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Year number (e.g. 2017)

rows.NAME: UXON Widget
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for widget definition

rows.NAME: UXON Action
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for action definition

rows.NAME: UXON Data Type
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for data type definition

rows.NAME: UXON Behavior
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for behavior definition

rows.NAME: Numeric String
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: A string with numbers only (0-9). In contrast to a nubmer, it can have leading zeroes. But no "-" sign or decimals are allowed. This type is meant for numeric ids stored as strings in the data source.

rows.NAME: UXON Connection Settings
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for data connection definition

rows.NAME: File Path
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: File and folder paths (agnostic to file system)

rows.NAME: PHP File Path
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Path to PHP files

rows.NAME: Locale
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: All locales currently installed: en, en_US, de, de_DE, etc.

rows.NAME: UXON Facade
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for facade configuration

rows.NAME: Policy Combining Algorithm
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Combining algorithm for security policies

rows.NAME: Policy Effect
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Effect of security policies: permit or deny

rows.NAME: Image Path
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: File path to an image

rows.NAME: Regular Expression Pattern
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: RegEx pattern enclosed in delimiters

rows.NAME: Empty (no data)
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Data type for empty values (e.g. for attributes, that cannot contain any value)

rows.NAME: Nested data
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: The value contains another objects data (a nested data sheet). Not all query builders support nested data - refer the documentation of the query builder.

rows.NAME: UXON Communication Channel
rows.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: User Experience Object Notation (JSON schema) for communication channel configuration
